question:
Mrs Barrett, an English-speaking woman who lives in your town, has
advertised for someone to help her in her home for a few hours a day

next summer.


Write a letter to Mrs Barrett. In your letter:
* suggest how you could help her in her home
* say why you would like to do this work
* explain when you will and will not be available
text: I checked your advertisement in which you mentioned that you were looking for someone to help you in your home. I am writing to you to express my interest to take up this job. For the upcoming summer, I can help you with your daily chores like cooking, cleaning and dog walking.

I would like this job because, in the summers, most   college students enjoy their semester break, so it is very difficult to find a part-time job elsewhere. Moreover, I have already worked as an assistant chef for a restaurant and know how to cook hygienic food. Additionally, I always wanted a dog for myself, so taking care of yours is something that I am really excited about.

As you already know that I will be on my semester break, and I will be available for two months in town. I would be working for you from 8 AM to 12 PM and would not be available in the evenings as I would also be doing a course on programming in addition to this job.
I am looking forward to hearing from you.
